content.description: Start on far right side on low vertical ledge. Then move to the left on some nice pocket/jugs and pull the slab section from the protruding arete with the chicken head on top. Finish at the peak of the slab where it becomes a triangle.
content.location: Starts on far right side low on vertical ledge

content.description: Mug Thug is the V3 maybe a 4 that starts on the central low arete with one hand on the good lip and the other on top as a pinch. Then move straight up to the flake above the start and work your way a little to the right to find the big pocket on the vertical face. It's a little throw to find the monster jug that you use to pull yourself up onto the slab section. Lastly navigate your way straight to the top right up the middle of the slab.
content.location: Stars on the central low arete with one hand on the good lop and the other on top as a pinch.

content.description: This is a larger boulder on the left side of Rusty Ravine (if you are facing the cliff). As with most of the southside, it remains pretty shaded, and after a rain it will seep water on the lower portions of the rock. Lots of pockets down low lead to a less than vertical but steep slab for the top out. Easy walk off on the other side.
